verses.kjv: Rejoice not, O Israel, for joy, as other people: for thou hast gone a whoring from thy God, thou hast loved a reward upon every cornfloor.
verses.web: Don’t rejoice, Israel, to jubilation like the nations; for you were unfaithful to your God. You love the wages of a prostitute at every grain threshing floor.
verses.ct: Don't celebrate, Israel! Don't shout for joy like other nations do. You've been unfaithful to your God — you've chased after other gods like a prostitute, loving the payments you received on every threshing floor.

verses.kjv: The floor and the winepress shall not feed them, and the new wine shall fail in her.
verses.web: The threshing floor and the wine press won’t feed them, and the new wine will fail her.
verses.ct: The threshing floors and winepresses won't produce enough to feed them, and the new wine will run dry.

verses.kjv: They shall not dwell in the LORD’s land; but Ephraim shall return to Egypt, and they shall eat unclean things in Assyria.
verses.web: They won’t dwell in LORD’s land; but Ephraim will return to Egypt, and they will eat unclean food in Assyria.
verses.ct: They won't stay in the LORD's land. Ephraim will go back to Egypt, and they'll eat unclean food in Assyria.

verses.kjv: They shall not offer wine offerings to the LORD, neither shall they be pleasing unto him: their sacrifices shall be unto them as the bread of mourners; all that eat thereof shall be polluted: for their bread for their soul shall not come into the house of the LORD.
verses.web: They won’t pour out wine offerings to LORD, neither will they be pleasing to him. Their sacrifices will be to them like the bread of mourners; all who eat of it will be polluted; for their bread will be for their appetite. It will not come into LORD’s house.
verses.ct: They won't pour out wine offerings to the LORD, and nothing they offer will please him. Their sacrifices will be like bread eaten at a funeral — everyone who eats it becomes unclean. Their food will only fill their stomachs; it won't be brought into the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: What will ye do in the solemn day, and in the day of the feast of the LORD?
verses.web: What will you do in the day of solemn assembly, and in the day of the feast of LORD?
verses.ct: What will you do when the sacred festivals come? What will you do on the feast days of the LORD?

verses.kjv: For, lo, they are gone because of destruction: Egypt shall gather them up, Memphis shall bury them: the pleasant places for their silver, nettles shall possess them: thorns shall be in their tabernacles.
verses.web: For, behold, they have gone away from destruction. Egypt will gather them up. Memphis will bury them. Nettles will possess their pleasant things of silver. Thorns will be in their tents.
verses.ct: Look — they're fleeing from destruction, but Egypt will round them up and Memphis will bury them. Weeds will overtake the places where they stored their silver treasures, and thorns will grow in their tents.

verses.kjv: The days of visitation are come, the days of recompence are come; Israel shall know it: the prophet is a fool, the spiritual man is mad, for the multitude of thine iniquity, and the great hatred.
verses.web: The days of visitation have come. The days of reckoning have come. Israel will consider the prophet to be a fool, and the man who is inspired to be insane, because of the abundance of your sins, and because your hostility is great.
verses.ct: The days of punishment have arrived. The days of payback are here. Israel will know it. They call the prophet a fool and the inspired man a madman — but that's because your sins are so many and your hostility is so fierce.

verses.kjv: The watchman of Ephraim was with my God: but the prophet is a snare of a fowler in all his ways, and hatred in the house of his God.
verses.web: A prophet watches over Ephraim with my God. A fowler’s snare is on all of his paths, and hostility in the house of his God.
verses.ct: The prophet is supposed to be Ephraim's watchman alongside my God, but instead a hunter's trap lies across every path he walks, and hostility fills the house of his God.

verses.kjv: They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah: therefore he will remember their iniquity, he will visit their sins.
verses.web: They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah. He will remember their iniquity. He will punish them for their sins.
verses.ct: They've sunk deep into corruption, just like in the days of Gibeah. God will remember their guilt and punish them for their sins.

verses.kjv: I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness; I saw your fathers as the firstripe in the fig tree at her first time: but they went to Baalpeor, and separated themselves unto that shame; and their abominations were according as they loved.
verses.web: I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness. I saw your fathers as the first ripe in the fig tree at its first season; but they came to Baal Peor, and consecrated themselves to the shameful thing, and became abominable like that which they loved.
verses.ct: "When I first found Israel, it was like discovering grapes in the desert. When I first saw your ancestors, they were like the earliest figs on a young tree. But then they went to Baal Peor and devoted themselves to that disgusting idol — and they became as vile as the thing they loved."

verses.kjv: As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird, from the birth, and from the womb, and from the conception.
verses.web: As for Ephraim, their glory will fly away like a bird. There will be no birth, no one with child, and no conception.
verses.ct: Ephraim's glory will fly away like a bird — no more births, no more pregnancies, not even conception.

verses.kjv: Though they bring up their children, yet will I bereave them, that there shall not be a man left: yea, woe also to them when I depart from them!
verses.web: Though they bring up their children, yet I will bereave them, so that not a man shall be left. Indeed, woe also to them when I depart from them!
verses.ct: Even if they do raise children, I'll take every one of them away until no one is left. How terrible it will be for them when I turn away from them!

verses.kjv: Ephraim, as I saw Tyrus, is planted in a pleasant place: but Ephraim shall bring forth his children to the murderer.
verses.web: I have seen Ephraim, like Tyre, planted in a pleasant place; but Ephraim will bring out his children to the murderer.
verses.ct: I once saw Ephraim planted in a beautiful place, like Tyre. But now Ephraim will lead his own children out to be slaughtered.

verses.kjv: Give them, O LORD: what wilt thou give? give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.
verses.web: Give them—LORD what will you give? Give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.
verses.ct: Give them, LORD — what should you give them? Give them wombs that miscarry and breasts that have no milk.

verses.kjv: All their wickedness is in Gilgal: for there I hated them: for the wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of mine house, I will love them no more: all their princes are revolters.
verses.web: “All their wickedness is in Gilgal; for there I hated them. Because of the wickedness of their deeds I will drive them out of my house! I will love them no more. All their princes are rebels.
verses.ct: "All their wickedness started at Gilgal — that's where I began to hate them. Because of their evil actions, I will drive them out of my house. I will love them no more. Every one of their leaders is a rebel."

verses.kjv: Ephraim is smitten, their root is dried up, they shall bear no fruit: yea, though they bring forth, yet will I slay even the beloved fruit of their womb.
verses.web: Ephraim is struck. Their root has dried up. They will bear no fruit. Even though they give birth, yet I will kill the beloved ones of their womb.”
verses.ct: Ephraim is struck down. Their roots have dried up, and they'll produce no fruit. Even if they do have children, I will kill the ones they love most.

verses.kjv: My God will cast them away, because they did not hearken unto him: and they shall be wanderers among the nations.
verses.web: My God will cast them away, because they didn’t listen to him; and they will be wanderers among the nations.
verses.ct: My God will reject them because they refused to listen to him, and they'll become wanderers among the nations.
